java.security

Interface Guard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AllPermission, AppsControlPermission, AWTPermission, BasicPermission, DripFeedPermission, FilePermission, IxcPermission, MediaSelectPermission, MonitorAppPermission, NetPermission, OcapIxcPermission, Permission, PropertyPermission, ProviderPermission, RCPermission, ReadPermission, ReflectPermission, RegisteredApiUserPermission, RuntimePermission, SecurityPermission, SelectPermission, SerializablePermission, ServiceContextPermission, ServiceTypePermission, SocketPermission, SSLPermission, TunerPermission, UnresolvedPermission, UserPreferencePermission

    public interface Guard

    This interface represents a guard, which is an object that is used to protect access to another object.

    This interface contains a single method, checkGuard, with a single object argument. checkGuard is invoked (by the GuardedObject getObject method) to determine whether or not to allow access to the object.

    Version:
    1.9 00/02/02
    Author:
    Roland Schemers, Li Gong
    See Also:
    GuardedObject

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkGuard(Object object)
      Determines whether or not to allow access to the guarded object object.

    • Method Detail

      • checkGuard

        void checkGuard(Object object)
                throws SecurityException
        Determines whether or not to allow access to the guarded object object. Returns silently if access is allowed. Otherwise, throws a SecurityException.
        Parameters:
        object - the object being protected by the guard.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - if access is denied.
